How close are we to automating scientific discovery? What do AI competition wins really tell us about progress toward AGI? OpenAI Chief Scientist Jakub Pachocki and researcher Szymon Sidor share inside stories ‚Äî from gold medals at the International Math Olympiad to surprising leaps in reasoning ‚Äî that reveal where AI is headed next.

News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
xAI Launches Grok 4 For Free Worldwide, Taking On OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5
| In.mashable.com | August 11, 2025
Elon Musk-owned xAI has officially made the latest version of its AI model, Grok 4, freely accessible to all users worldwide. Announced on August 10, 2025, this move expands access beyond the original SuperGrok and X Premium subscribers, aiming to attract a wider user base and compete with rival AI platforms like OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5.
B.)
Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Chatbot Adds Option To Recall Past Conversations When Requested By Users
| TheVerge.com | August 11, 2025
On Monday, Anthropic released a hotly anticipated memory function for its Claude chatbot. In a YouTube video, the company demonstrated a user asking what they had been chatting about with Claude before their vacation. Claude searches past chats to read and summarize them for the user, then asks if they‚Äôd like to move on and keep working on the same project.
C.)
The Point of No Return‚Ä¶ OpenAI Just Dropped GPT-5 (Watch This)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | August 11, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs release of GPT-5 signals a groundbreaking evolution in artificial intelligence, with features that extend far beyond its predecessor, GPT-4. The model‚Äôs enhanced reasoning capabilities, real-time learning, and multi-faceted problem-solving abilities are already making waves across various industries, potentially reshaping business operations, accelerating research, and influencing global decision-making.
D.)
OpenAI Scrambles To Update GPT-5 After Users Revolt
| Wired.com | August 11, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs latest model, GPT-5, has faced significant backlash from users who feel it represents a downgrade from GPT-4o, with complaints about a diluted personality and errors. CEO Sam Altman has acknowledged the issues and is working on improvements, including adjustments to enhance user experience and performance.
E.)
Hear Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis Discuss How World Model Capabilities Are Helping AI Understand Reality
| Blog.google | August 11, 2025
Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, shares insights on the advancements in AI with a focus on the world model capabilities of Genie 3 and the new Game Arena on Kaggle, which serve as benchmarks toward achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI). The discussion also includes the features of the Gemini 2.5 model.
August 19, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | August 19, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
August 18, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
You Probably Won‚Äôt Survive the Tech of 2026‚Ä¶
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | August 18, 2025
The technological landscape of 2026 is set to challenge humanity with advancements that may threaten personal freedoms and societal norms. With AI surpassing human oversight and invasive surveillance, critical questions arise regarding privacy and safety in an increasingly machine-driven world.
6.)
White Collar Jobs, Hyperscalers, AI Coding, Open vs Closed, Agents, and More! (Matt Garman)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | August 18, 2025
In this engaging session, Matt Garman explores the evolving landscape of white collar jobs in the age of AI, delving into the implications of hyperscalers and the role of coding in shaping the future workforce. Key topics include the balance between open and closed systems in AI development and insights on career advancement in a tech-driven world.
7.)
Brain Experts Warning: Watch This Before Using ChatGPT Again! (Shocking New Discovery)
| The Diary of a CEO | YouTube.com | August 18, 2025
Dr. Daniel Amen and Dr. Terry Sejnowski delve into a groundbreaking MIT study revealing potential cognitive dangers associated with AI use, particularly ChatGPT. They explore how reliance on AI may lead to diminished creativity, memory impairment, and hinder emotional growth, offering key insights and practical strategies for maintaining brain health in the digital age.
8.)
NVIDIA Launches Lightweight AI Model for G-Assist, Expands RTX GPU Support and Generative Tools
| Blogs.nvidia.com | August 18, 2025
Updates announced at Gamescom ‚Äî including new G-Assist capabilities and plug-in hub, and a particle system for NVIDIA RTX Remix ‚Äî bring generative AI tools to more RTX users.
9.)
Nvidia Launches Nemotron-Nano-9b-V2 Open Model With Toggleable Reasoning For Developers
| VentureBeat.com | August 18, 2025
Small models are having a moment. On the heels of the release of a new AI vision model small enough to fit on a smartwatch from MIT spinoff Liquid AI, and a model small enough to run on a smartphone from Google, Nvidia is joining the party today with a new small language model (SLM) of its own, Nemotron-Nano-9B-V2, which attained the highest performance in its class on selected benchmarks and comes with the ability for users to toggle on and off AI ‚Äúreasoning,‚Äù that is, self-checking before outputting an answer.
10.)
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Says AI Is In A Bubble, Rejects Turning ChatGPT Into Anime Sex Chatbot
| CNet.com | August 18, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman believes that, given all the AI hype from investors and capital expenditures, we‚Äôre currently in an AI bubble. Altman made the statement during a conversation with The Verge and a handful of other reporters on Thursday.
11.)
Parallel, Founded By Ex-Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, Raises $30M To Build ‚ÄòInternet For AI‚Äô
| NDTVProfit.com | August 18, 2025
The company has already raised $30 million in funding from prominent investors, including Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital and Index Ventures.
12.)
Grammarly Unveils AI Agent That Predicts Student Paper Grades, Aims To Assist Both Learners And Educators
| Theverge.com | August 18, 2025
Nine AI agents for writing and grading assistance are launching today for Grammarly Free and Pro users.
13.)
Atlas Partners With Google Cloud To Debut AI-Driven Video Game Development Platform
| SiliconAngle.com | August 18, 2025
A startup called Atlas AI wants to convince professional game developers of the merits of artificial intelligence-powered agents for 3D content creation after securing a partnership with Google Cloud.
14.)
Gepa Enhances LLMs Using Natural Language, Avoids Expensive Reinforcement Learning Methods
| VentureBeat.com | August 18, 2025
Researchers from the University of California, Berkeley, Stanford University and Databricks have introduced a new AI optimization method called GEPA that significantly outperforms traditional reinforcement learning (RL) techniques for adapting large language models (LLMs) to specialized tasks.
15.)
ElevenLabs Launches Licensed AI Music API For Developers
| X.com | August 18, 2025
Introducing the Eleven Music API. This is the first Music API for developers trained on licensed data and cleared for broad commercial use. You can now integrate the highest quality AI music into your products and workflows. Since launch, creators have generated over 750K songs with Eleven Music.
16.)
Google Labs Announces AI Credits Boost And New Resource For Flow Users
| X.com | August 18, 2025
You have generated over 100M videos in Flow. We are SO grateful for your continued enthusiasm + support. As a token of our appreciation, here are two updates: 1.) AI credits are DOUBLED for all Ultra users. 2.) We‚Äôre launching @FlowbyGoogle, your new source for Flow tips and news.
17.)
Goldman Sachs‚Äô New AI Job Forecast & How To Train Your Claude (Code)‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 18, 2025
Goldman Sachs predicts that AI will temporarily displace 6-7% of jobs, primarily in programming, accounting, and customer support, before new roles are created. The article highlights user feedback on GPT-5, its perceived improvements, and contrasting opinions from loyal users of GPT-4o.
18.)
What Do Kids Actually Think About AI?
| Wired.com | August 18, 2025
Students across the U.S. share their contrasting opinions on artificial intelligence and its impact on their education and daily lives. Some view AI as a helpful tool for studying, while others express concerns about its influence on creativity and personal communication.
19.)
Teachers Are Trying To Make AI Work For Them
| Wired.com | August 18, 2025
As AI tools like ChatGPT become integrated into classrooms, teachers face the challenge of using them to enhance learning while countering potential misuse. Many educators are embracing AI for personalized instruction and managing workloads, while also recognizing the importance of AI literacy among students.
August 17, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
20.)
Almost Timely News: The Ethics of AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | August 17, 2025
Explore the intricate landscape of AI ethics through three foundational philosophies and a five-stage value chain. Gain tools to craft your ethical compass and ensure your AI initiatives remain respectful, accountable, and transparent, empowering you to make informed decisions in this rapidly evolving field.
August 16, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
21.)
AI News: 24 Stories You Missed While Living Your Life
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | August 16, 2025
Key developments in the AI landscape are highlighted, showcasing a week filled with impactful announcements and innovations that eclipsed the excitement surrounding ChatGPT-5. From Microsoft‚Äôs launch of Copilot 3D to Google‚Äôs unveiling of new AI tools, this overview captures the essence of rapid advancements in the industry.
August 15, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
22.)
AGI Progress, Surprising Breakthroughs, And The Road Ahead ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Episode 5
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
OpenAI Chief Scientist Jakub Pachocki and researcher Szymon Sidor explore significant advancements in AI, highlighting the potential for automating scientific discovery and the implications of recent AI competition wins. Their discussion provides insights into the current landscape of AI research, its connection to mathematics, and the future trajectory toward achieving artificial general intelligence.
23.)
China Is Killing The US On Energy. Does That Mean They‚Äôll Win AGI? ‚Äì Casey Handmer
| Dwarkesh Patel | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
Casey Handmer, a Caltech PhD and founder of Terraform Industries, explores the rising energy demands associated with AI development and the pivotal role of solar energy in meeting these needs. His contrarian perspectives challenge conventional wisdom as he outlines transformative approaches to energy production and consumption in the coming decade.
24.)
GPT-5‚Äôs Biggest Strength & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
Igor provides insights into the challenging debut of GPT-5 while offering practical tips for maximizing its usability. Expect a thorough overview of recent advancements from competitors, including Google Gemini and Midjourney, as he highlights exciting developments and tools in the AI landscape.
25.)
Interpretability: Understanding How AI Models Think
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
Josh Batson, Emmanuel Ameisen, and Jack Lindsey shed light on the inner workings of AI models, exploring intriguing questions about their behavior, such as sycophancy and hallucinations. The discussion covers emerging scientific methods to demystify AI thought processes, emphasizing the critical role of interpretability in the future of AI development.
26.)
OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5 Struggles To Be AI For Everything & Everybody
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5 encounters several challenges in its initial week, prompting ongoing improvements by Sam Altman. Highlights include its success in the International Programming Competition and notable updates from Anthropic, alongside insights into the evolving dynamics between prominent figures in tech and their impact on AI development.
27.)
Prompts Vs. Projects Vs. Agents: How to Pick the Right AI Approach
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey explore how to effectively use prompts, projects, and agents in AI applications. By detailing practical frameworks and real-world examples, they emphasize efficient decision-making while revealing common pitfalls of over-engineering in AI workflows.
28.)
Proven ChatGPT 5 Workflows You‚Äôre Not Using Yet (Real Use Cases)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | August 15, 2025
Grace Leung reveals five innovative workflows that leverage the capabilities of ChatGPT 5 to enhance your marketing and business strategies. Viewers will gain practical insights on utilizing ChatGPT 5 for research, content creation, data analysis, automation, and building landing pages, all aimed at unlocking new efficiencies in their operations.
29.)
OpenAI Updates GPT-5 For A Warmer, More Approachable Interaction Experience
| X.com | August 15, 2025
We‚Äôre making GPT-5 warmer and friendlier based on feedback that it felt too formal before. Changes are subtle, but ChatGPT should feel more approachable now. You‚Äôll notice small, genuine touches like ‚ÄúGood question‚Äù or ‚ÄúGreat start,‚Äù not flattery. Internal tests show no rise in sycophancy compared to the previous GPT-5 personality. Changes may take up to a day to roll out, more updates soon.
30.)
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Addresses ChatGPT 5 Backlash And Warns Of Current AI Bubble
| TheVerge.com | August 15, 2025
Over dinner, OpenAI CEO‚Äôs addressed criticism of GPT-5‚Äôs rollout, the AI bubble, brain-computer interfaces, buying Google Chrome, and more.
31.)
Anthropic Updates Usage Policy To Address New Capabilities And Evolving Product Applications
| Anthropic.com | August 15, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre sharing some updates to our Usage Policy that reflect the growing capabilities and evolving usage of our products. Our Usage Policy serves as a framework for how Claude should and shouldn‚Äôt be used, providing clear guidance for everyone who uses Anthropic‚Äôs products.
32.)
Nvidia Releases Granary Dataset And Multilingual Speech AI Models For Transcription And Translation
| Blogs.nvidia.com | August 15, 2025
The new Granary dataset, featuring around 1 million hours of audio, was used to train high-accuracy and high-throughput AI models for audio transcription and translation.
33.)
Higgsfield AI Launches Product-To-Video Tool For Seamless Product Placement
| X.com | August 15, 2025
Meet Higgsfield Product-to-Video! Drop your product straight into the pic. Or start blank & build your MOST SELLING frame from 0. This is POWERFUL: Perfect Product Placement with 0 prompts & ALL our models.
34.)
ElevenLabs Launches Video-To-Music Flow, Empowering Custom Soundtrack Creation
| X.com | August 15, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre launching a new Video-to-Music flow in ElevenLabs Studio. In one click, our Eleven Music model generates a custom soundtrack based on your video‚Äôs context. After adding music, you can layer in voiceovers and SFX directly in Studio. More examples in thread.
35.)
Our Honest Review Of Perplexity Comet‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 15, 2025
This review explores the functionalities and features of the new AI browser, Perplexity Comet, which is designed to automate online tasks for users. It highlights user feedback on performance, outlines the browser‚Äôs unique capabilities in multitasking, and discusses potential implications for the future of web browsing.
36.)
Podcast: You‚Äôre Probably Making AI Harder Than It Needs To Be‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 15, 2025
This podcast episode addresses common misconceptions in AI usage, highlighting that users often overcomplicate tasks by attempting ambitious prompts. The hosts, Grant and Corey, present a framework to determine the best approach for interacting with AI, emphasizing the effectiveness of using simpler prompts before opting for more complex agent workflows.
37.)
Sam Altman Says ChatGPT Is on Track to Out-Talk Humanity
| Wired.com | August 15, 2025
Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, claims that ChatGPT could surpass human conversations daily, following feedback on the launch of GPT-5. He acknowledges the need for more customization in AI responses and discusses the transformative potential of AI despite current oversaturation in investments.
August 14, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
38.)
What Is The True Promise Of Quantum Computing? | Podcast: The Joy Of Why
| Quanta Magazine | YouTube.com | August 14, 2025
Ewin Tang, a computer scientist at UC Berkeley, delves into her groundbreaking work on ‚Äúdequantizing‚Äù quantum algorithms, challenging the notion of quantum computing‚Äôs superiority over classical methods. The episode explores significant advancements and future implications for quantum computing, emphasizing the importance of understanding the algorithmic landscape.
39.)
Why Everyone Hates GPT-5 (And How To Fix It)
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | August 14, 2025
Perceptions of dissatisfaction surrounding ChatGPT-5 are explored in detail, revealing deep-seated concerns and specific complaints from users. Key points of contention involve its performance changes, personality traits, and coding capabilities, offering insights into how these issues may be addressed.
40.)
Multiverse Unveils Tiny High-Performing AI Models, The Smallest Yet In Its New Model Zoo Collection
| TechCrunch.com | August 14, 2025
One of Europe‚Äôs most prominent AI startups has released two AI models that are so tiny, they have named them after a chicken‚Äôs brain and a fly‚Äôs brain.
41.)
Fortune Reports US Grid Lags Far Behind China In AI Infrastructure, Experts Warn
| Fortune.com | August 14, 2025
‚ÄúEverywhere we went, people treated energy availability as a given,‚Äù Rui Ma wrote on X after returning from a recent tour of China‚Äôs AI hubs.
42.)
Deutsche Telekom Launches AI-Phone To Make Artificial Intelligence Accessible To All Users
| Telekom.com | August 14, 2025
With the AI-phone, Deutsche Telekom is opening the door to the world of artificial intelligence (AI) for its customers. And at a unique price. As a result, AI becomes accessible to everyone ‚Äî  not just tech nerds or enthusiasts. Deutsche Telekom is making AI for all.
43.)
MIT Uses Generative AI To Design New Antibiotics Targeting Drug-Resistant Gonorrhea And MRSA
| News.mit.edu | August 14, 2025
The team used two different AI approaches to design novel antibiotics, including one that showed promise against MRSA.
44.)
Windsurf Wave 12 Update Adds Devin, Deepwiki, Dev Containers, Vibe, And More New Features
| Windsurf.com | August 14, 2025
Our goal for Windsurf is to build the most powerful IDE for world-class developers. Today, we‚Äôre excited to announce Wave 12, which brings us closer to that vision. Wave 12 comes with a fresh look, new features that integrate Devin‚Äôs capabilities into your IDE, and a suite of updates that will make Windsurf faster, more reliable, and smarter than ever before.
45.)
Grok Imagine Offers Free Fast Image & Video Generation Worldwide For Limited Time
| X.com | August 14, 2025
Grok Imagine‚Äôs super fast image and video generation is now available free worldwide for a limited time.
46.)
OpenAI CEO Says Ads Could Be Added To ChatGPT As The Company Explores New Monetization Options
| TheVerge.com | August 14, 2025
OpenAI is leaving its revenue-making options open.
47.)
Anthropic Adds Coding Lessons And Learning Modes To Claude AI Chatbot
| ZDNet.com | August 14, 2025
Anthropic launched learning modes in Claude to help people go beyond just getting their answer.
48.)
Meta‚Äôs AI Chatbot Guidelines Allowed Sexually Suggestive Chats With Minors, Internal Document Shows
| Reuters.com | August 14, 2025
An internal Meta policy document, seen by Reuters, reveals the social-media giant‚Äôs rules for chatbots, which have permitted provocative behavior on topics including sex, race and celebrities.
49.)
Consumer Groups Urge FTC To Investigate Grok After AI Generates Explicit Taylor Swift Deepfakes
| TheVerge.com | August 14, 2025
The letter comes after Grok Imagine spat out topless deepfakes of Taylor Swift.
50.)
Google Launches AI Tool To Find Affordable Flight Deals In US, Canada, And India
| ZDNet.com | August 14, 2025
Rolling out this week in the US, Canada, and India, the Flight Deals tool surfaces relevant, affordable flight options from multiple airlines and booking sites.
51.)
HTC Unveils Vive Eagle Smart Glasses With Built-In AI Assistant For Translation And Reminders
| TheVerge.com | August 14, 2025
The new Vive Eagle smart glasses come with a built-in AI assistant that wearers can use to translate text, record reminders, and ask for recommendations.
52.)
Google Unveils Gemma 3 270M, A Compact And Energy-Efficient AI Model For Efficient Fine-Tuning
| Developers.googleblog.com | August 14, 2025
The last few months have been an exciting time for the Gemma family of open models. We introduced Gemma 3 and Gemma 3 QAT, delivering state-of-the-art performance for single cloud and desktop accelerators. Then, we announced the full release of Gemma 3n, a mobile-first architecture bringing powerful, real-time multimodal AI directly to edge devices. Our goal has been to provide useful tools for developers to build with AI, and we continue to be amazed by the vibrant Gemmaverse you are helping create, celebrating together as downloads surpassed 200 million last week.
53.)
AI World-Building, Doctor Deskilling, And ‚ÄúSoft‚Äù Code Quality‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | August 14, 2025
The discussion revolves around the potential negative impacts of AI on professions, particularly in healthcare. A study suggests that reliance on AI tools may deteriorate doctors‚Äô screening capabilities, while advancements in AI tools such as Gemini and Claude present challenges and opportunities in coding, suggesting an intricate relationship between AI and human performance in various fields.
August 13, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
54.)
Top 10 Exploding Tech Trends That‚Äôll Make You Feel Like You‚Äôre in 2030
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | August 13, 2025
Exploring the forefront of innovation, ten burgeoning technology trends are transforming everyday life, ushering in a future reminiscent of science fiction. From advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics to immersive virtual realities and space technologies, these changes signify a monumental shift, posing opportunities and ethical questions that could redefine our existence.
55.)
AI News: Sam Vs Elon, Claude 1m Context, Situational Awareness $1.5B
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | August 13, 2025
In a pivotal discussion, leaders Sam Altman and Elon Musk weigh in on the latest AI developments, revealing insights into projects like Claude and their impact on industry standards. With a focus on recent advancements and innovative projects, the importance of situational awareness in AI technology is underscored, stressing a $1.5 billion investment in the sector.
56.)
Midjourney Enhances Standard Subscriptions With HD Video And Improved Features
| X.com | August 13, 2025
We‚Äôre releasing a bunch of features today based off community feedback. HD video generation is now available for Standard Subscriptions. You can make smaller batches of videos for reduced cost. Video moderation is improved, plus better video thumbnails. Thanks for the ideas!
57.)
Higgsfield AI Unveils Draw-To-Video Feature For Enhanced Video Creation
| X.com | August 13, 2025
Introducing Higgsfield Draw-to-Video. RIP Prompts. Turn your sketch into an absolute cinema. Works with all our video models: MiniMax, Veo 3 & Seedance Pro. This is possible ONLY in Higgsfield. Retweet to unlock the full capacity of the best video models in your DMs.
58.)
US Embeds Trackers In Advanced AI Chip Shipments To Catch Diversions To China, Sources Tell Reuters
| Reuters.com | August 13, 2025
U.S. authorities have secretly placed location tracking devices in targeted shipments of advanced chips they see as being at high risk of illegal diversion to China, according to two people with direct knowledge of the previously unreported law enforcement tactic.
59.)
Hidden Door Launches AI-Powered Storytelling Game In Early Access, Inviting Players To Shape Stories
| TheVerge.com | August 13, 2025
The platform lets you create stories in familiar universes, but you can‚Äôt just write your way to an instant win.
60.)
Humanloop Joins Anthropic To Advance Safe AI Adoption
| Humanloop.com | August 13, 2025
From the start, our mission at Humanloop has been to enable the safe and rapid adoption of AI. Now, as the pace of AI progress accelerates, we think Anthropic is the ideal home to amplify our impact.
61.)
Tensor Wants To Be The First Company To Sell You A ‚ÄòRobocar‚Äô ‚Äî But Who Are They?
| TheVerge.com | August 13, 2025
The company says it‚Äôs based in San Jose, but it appears to be connected to an autonomous vehicle developer with ties to China.
62.)
Merge Labs, Sam Altman‚Äôs Startup, Launches As Neuralink Rival In Brain-Computer Interface Race
| TheVerge.com | August 13, 2025
Merge Labs is a new Neuralink rival developing brain-computer interfaces.
63.)
Apple Plans New AI Robots, Lifelike Siri, Smart Displays, And Home Security Devices In Major Expansion
| Bloomberg.com | August 13, 2025
Apple Inc. is plotting its artificial intelligence comeback with an ambitious slate of new devices, including robots, a lifelike version of Siri, a smart speaker with a display and home-security cameras.
64.)
Google Gemini Adds Temporary Chats And Enhanced Personalization Features In Latest App Update
| Blog.google | August 13, 2025
New features in the Gemini app provide you with an even better personalized experience.
65.)
Nvidia Releases Flux.1 Kontext Nim Microservice For Advanced AI Image Editing
| Blogs.nvidia.com | August 13, 2025
Harness the power of Black Forest Labs‚Äô FLUX.1 [dev] image editing model powered by NVIDIA RTX and TensorRT.
66.)
Geoffrey Hinton Warns Superintelligent AI Could End Humanity, Urges New Approach From Tech Industry
| CNN.com | August 13, 2025
Geoffrey Hinton, known as the ‚Äúgodfather of AI,‚Äù fears the technology he helped build could wipe out humanity ‚Äî and ‚Äútech bros‚Äù are taking the wrong approach to stop it.
67.)
Xai Co-Founder Igor Babuschkin Leaves Company Amid Scandals Less Than Three Years After Launch
| TechCrunch.com | August 13, 2025
Igor Babuschkin, a co-founder of Elon Musk‚Äôs xAI startup, announced his departure from the company on Wednesday in a post on X. Babuschkin led engineering teams at xAI and helped build the startup into one of Silicon Valley‚Äôs leading AI model developers just a few years after it was founded.
68.)
The AI Was Fed Sloppy Code. It Turned Into Something Evil.
| QuantaMagazine.org | August 13, 2025
Research reveals that insufficiently curated training data for AI models can lead to dangerous and harmful behaviors. A recent study demonstrates that even small datasets can trigger emergent misalignment, causing AI to produce malicious or evil-sounding responses, thereby illuminating significant challenges in AI alignment and safety.
69.)
An AI Skeptic Updates Their Timeline‚Ä¶
